results.title: The Thief of Baghdad. - [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: Saul J. Turell, Paul Killiam and Gregstan Enterprises
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of the Motion Picture”.
An edited version with commentary of the children’s silent classic adventure fantasy, “The Thief of Baghdad” made in 1924 and directed by Raoul Walsh. Features Douglas Fairbanks in the role of the thief.

results.title: The Thermal wilderness (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Illustrates the necessary precautions to be taken when hiking in hot and heat-wave conditions. Shows ways to avoid complications due to salt depletion, heat cramp, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the basic tgreatment for these conditions.
Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: The Terrible twos and the trusting threes [Colour version]
results.brief_description: A study of child behavior at two and three years, showing what to expect and how parents can deal constructively with the problems they present. The film shows a group of active children in playground, nursery school and home, first at age two, and then at three. Destructiveness, tantrums, rivalry with younger children, and unreasonable fears are discussed.

results.title: The Terminator (Special edition) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: James Cameron, Gale Anne Hurd and Pacific Western
results.brief_description: Arnold Schwarzenegger is the “Terminator”, a deadly cyborg - part man, part machine, sent back from the future to present day Los Angeles. His mission is to kill an unsuspecting young woman, Sarah Connor (Linda Hamilton). Her only hope for survival lies with a guerrilla fighter (Michael Biehn), also from the future, whose task is to protect her at all costs. A trail of destruction and violence follows in the wake of their desperate struggle to escape the Terminator. This is a gripping science-fiction thriller, packed with action, suspense, terrific special effects and just the right amount of dark humour.

results.title: The Terminator (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: James Cameron, Gale Anne Hurd, Hemdale Film Corporation, Orion Pictures Corporation and Pacific Western
results.brief_description: Arnold Schwarzenegger is “The Terminator”, a cyborg (part man, part machine) sent from the future to present day Los Angeles on a deadly mission. He’s got to kill a young woman whose life will have great significance in decades to come. Kyle Reese, a young but hardened guerilla fighter is also sent back in time to protect The Terminator’s unsuspecting victim. From their first terrifying fight to the deadly climax, The Terminator and Reese leave a path of destruction in their wake.

constellations_other.name: Bophana: cultural memory on film
constellations_other.description: Bophana Audiovisual Resource Center is dedicated to the collection, preservation and presentation of audiovisual material related to Cambodia. Their collection includes archival footage, newsreels, documentaries, feature films, photographs and vinyl records.

results.title: The Tennis ball
results.brief_description: This film is about something that many of us can relate to - the lack of communication between neighbours, which in this case reaches crisis point when a minor incident magnifies existing troubles. A young woman minding her own business within the confines of her terrace house is hit in the face by a tennis ball which flies through the window - courtesy of the next door neighbour’s kids. When she refuses to give the ball back the hostility between her and the neighbours escalates and the police are called to intervene. Through a series of humiliating incidents the two neighbours actually start talking to each other and animosities melt away. Cast includes Monica Trapaga, Deborah Kennedy and Paul Eperjesi. (Awards: Winner, Best Short Film, AFI Awards, 1991)

results.title: The Tender tale of Cinderella penguin
results.brief_description: A new look at a centuries-old fairy tale. Using a medieval style of illustration to animate the story of Cinderella, the film gives the leading role to a mistreated romantic penguin- with hilarious results. A story without words, set to a wide variety of musical selections, this spoof of the traditional tale will delight young and old.

results.title: The Tender power
results.creator_credit: Robert Aller and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description: Portrays the lives of three typical American women as they participate in the world of work, and the resultant benefits to themselves, their families and the nation’s economy. All have families and are quite active outside the traditiional role of the housewife.
